intro: Parnassia scaposa, commonly known as the mountain buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its pale yellow flowers with five petals and a distinctive central nectary. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mountain meadows and forested areas. Its leaves are palmately divided and often have a waxy coating. Parnassia scaposa is known for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
